RELEVANT EXPERIENCE
Heimdal
HeimdalBUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
Heimdal builds Direct Air Capture (DAC) facilities across the US. 
In a generalist role that extended beyond conventional business
development, I contributed to people management, strategy
development, research & analysis and more (see page 2).
FOUNDER’S ASSOCIATE / EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT
Initially an operational role with increasing strategic involvement.
Until June 2023, Heimdal operated under the name 42AD, a
subsidiary focused on building a food automation solution.
After prompting collaborative & transparent discussion on our food
product, 42AD was closed and Heimdal returned to DAC. 
Bio-Li SolutionsCHIEF OPERATING OFFICER (UNIVERSITY PROJECT)SKILLSDurham UniversityBSc NATURAL SCIENCES | First Class
Imperial College London MSc THEORETICAL PHYSICS | n/a First Class with Outstanding Achieve-
ment Award (>75%) in Year 1, 2 & 3
Top score in ~30% (5/16) of all
modules taken in 2nd and 3rd year
Top 3 in over 50% of modules
(average class size ~100)
Yearly averages: 80, 78, 76 
I made the decision to leave Imperial in
Year 1 at the end of second term. 2019 - 2022
2017 - 2018Jul 23 - Nov 23
Nov 22 - Jul 23 
Oct 21 - Jun 22 
Led a team of 7, developing a plan to commercialise novel lithium-
ion battery recycling technology.
I proactively built UK industry relationships to understand pain-
points and provide a needed solution, leading to a Carbon13 offer.OTHER EXPERIENCE
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT In two instances, consulted by CEO(s) on colleagues’ futures, I advised
redirecting their efforts to tasks aligning with their skills. The results: one  
colleague - an intern - created Heimdal’s current website, while another
now focuses on in-house skill development for crucial technology
assessments. 
EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS Originated and drafted the initial op-ed released in Carbon Herald (Oct
2023) to generate momentum for Heimdal's funding round and establish
Heimdal as a thought leader. The piece prompted a follow-up in Semafor,
positioning Heimdal in discussions with industry leaders Climeworks and
Heirloom, and has already facilitated financing opportunities.
STRATEGIC CONNECTIONS
Mostly generated opportunities through networking and outreach, either
leveraging existing networks, forging new direct relationships or indirect
relationships. Generated a pipeline of potential deals with injection well
partners, as well as a pipeline of opportunities and ideas for the sale of
carbon credits alongside accompanying presentations.HEIMDAL EXPERIENCE
IN DETAIL
RESEARCH & ANALYSIS Completed three central research projects: 45Q, California-LCFS &
regulatory compliance. Provided comprehensive 45Q insights through  
research and expert discussion. Evaluated California-LCFS feasibility for
short-term revenue. Ensured compliance through cultivating a robust
relationship with the Oklahoma Dept. of Environmental Quality.
Contributor to central strategy development. Working closely with the CEO
& lead engineering team, I drove & originated critical initiatives such as
revenue stream selection, personnel decisions, scaling strategy &
stakeholder engagement. STRATEGY DEVELOPMENTForged strategic connections via targeted networking, connecting with key
stakeholders like press channels (e.g., WSJ, Bloomberg), regulators (e.g.,
CARB), and industry experts. Attended events independently, both
domestic and international. Also conducted targeted outreach and
meetings, overall contributing >10 unequivocally strategic connections. 
OPPORTUNITY GENERATION

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
